directions: Heat butter in a 6-qt. pot over medium heat. Add cardamom, fenugreek, and nigella and cook, stirring often, until fragrant, 1–2 minutes. Increase heat to medium-high and add oil; add onions and cook, stirring often, until browned, 10 minutes. Add garlic, chiles, and ginger and cook, stirring often, until soft and fragrant, 3 minutes. Add collards, 1⅓ cups water, and salt and pepper; cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until collards are tender, 50–55 minutes. Stir in vinegar and serve collards hot.
ingredients: ⅛ tsp. black cardamom seeds ⅛ tsp. ground fenugreek ⅛ tsp. nigella seeds ¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil 1 large yellow onion, minced 3 cloves garlic, minced 2 Thai chiles, stemmed, seeded, and minced 1 1" piece ginger, peeled and minced 1½ lbs. collard greens, stemmed and cut crosswise into ¼"-wide strips Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste White wine vinegar, to taste
title: Ye'Abesha Gomen (Ethiopian Collard Greens)
